questions.question: Complete the idiom: 'eager ___' (meaning: very enthusiastic and hard-working)
questions.explanation: 'Eager beaver' describes someone who is very enthusiastic and hard-working.

questions.question: Complete the idiom: 'let the cat out of the ___' (meaning: reveal a secret)
questions.explanation: 'Let the cat out of the bag' means to reveal a secret accidentally.

questions.question: Complete the idiom: 'a red rag to a ___' (meaning: something that makes someone very angry)
questions.explanation: 'A red rag to a bull' means something that provokes someone to anger.

questions.question: Complete the idiom: 'cut a long story ___' (meaning: be precise)
questions.explanation: 'Cut a long story short' means to tell only the essential parts.

questions.question: Complete the idiom: 'be all ___' (meaning: listen very attentively)
questions.explanation: 'Be all ears' means to listen with complete attention.

questions.question: Complete the idiom: 'barking up the wrong ___' (meaning: doing something that will not get the desired result)
questions.explanation: 'Barking up the wrong tree' means pursuing the wrong course of action.

questions.question: Complete the idiom: 'get on your high ___' (meaning: behave haughtily)
questions.explanation: 'Get on your high horse' means to behave in an arrogant manner.

questions.question: Complete the idiom: 'keep your nose to the ___' (meaning: keep working hard)
questions.explanation: 'Keep your nose to the grindstone' means to work hard continuously.

questions.question: Complete the idiom: 'set the world on ___' (meaning: do something remarkable)
questions.explanation: 'Set the world on fire' means to do something extraordinary.

questions.question: Complete the idiom: 'on cloud ___' (meaning: very happy)
questions.explanation: 'On cloud nine' means being extremely happy or elated.

questions.question: Complete the idiom: 'hold the ___' (meaning: take charge when the person in charge is away)
questions.explanation: 'Hold the fort' means to take responsibility while someone is away.

questions.question: Complete the idiom: 'make a ___ for' (meaning: go directly towards something)
questions.explanation: 'Make a beeline for' means to go straight towards something.

questions.question: Complete the idiom: 'take the bull by the ___' (meaning: handle difficulty boldly)
questions.explanation: 'Take the bull by the horns' means to face a difficult situation directly.

questions.question: Complete the idiom: 'face the ___' (meaning: face the consequences)
questions.explanation: 'Face the music' means to accept the consequences of your actions.

questions.question: Complete the idiom: 'a dog in the ___' (meaning: preventing others from using what you don't need)
questions.explanation: 'A dog in the manger' describes someone who prevents others from having what they don't use themselves.

questions.question: Complete the idiom: 'weather the ___' (meaning: overcome a difficult situation)
questions.explanation: 'Weather the storm' means to survive or overcome a difficult period.

questions.question: Complete the proverb: 'Nothing ventured, nothing ___.'
questions.explanation: This proverb means you cannot achieve anything without taking risks.

questions.question: Complete the proverb: 'Prevention is better than ___.'
questions.explanation: It is easier to prevent something than to fix it afterwards.

questions.question: Complete the proverb: 'The proof of the pudding is in the ___.'
questions.explanation: The real value can only be judged by practical experience.

questions.question: Complete the proverb: 'The early bird catches the ___.'
questions.explanation: Those who act promptly get the best opportunities.

questions.question: Complete the proverb: 'Birds of a feather flock ___.'
questions.explanation: People with similar interests tend to associate with each other.

questions.question: Complete the proverb: 'You can take a horse to water, but you can't make it ___.'
questions.explanation: You can give opportunity but cannot force someone to use it.

questions.question: Complete the proverb: 'A fool and his money are soon ___.'
questions.explanation: A foolish person will quickly lose their money.

questions.question: Complete the proverb: 'Still waters run ___.'
questions.explanation: A quiet person may have hidden depth of character.

questions.question: Complete the proverb: 'A stitch in time saves ___.'
questions.explanation: Acting quickly prevents bigger problems later.

questions.question: Complete the proverb: 'A burnt child dreads the ___.'
questions.explanation: A bad experience makes one cautious.

questions.question: Complete the proverb: 'Hard work always pays ___.'
questions.explanation: Consistent effort leads to success.

questions.question: Complete the proverb: 'A new broom sweeps ___.'
questions.explanation: New people in charge often make many changes at first.

questions.question: Complete the proverb: 'Tall oaks from small ___ grow.'
questions.explanation: Great things can have humble beginnings.

questions.question: Complete the proverb: 'The darkest hour is just before the ___.'
questions.explanation: Things often improve after the most difficult time.

questions.question: Fill in the blank: Once Ajit makes a promise, he always abides ___ it.
questions.explanation: 'Abide by' means to follow or comply with something.

questions.question: Fill in the blank: He must abstain ___ all the things that are not good for him.
questions.explanation: 'Abstain from' means to keep away from something.

questions.question: Fill in the blank: Father acceded ___ our suggestion immediately.
questions.explanation: 'Accede to' means to agree or consent to something.

questions.question: Fill in the blank: These conditions are not acceptable ___ any of the candidates.
questions.explanation: 'Acceptable to' means agreeable to someone.

questions.question: Fill in the blank: The snowfall was accompanied ___ a light drizzle.
questions.explanation: 'Accompanied with' means something appearing along with something else.

questions.question: Fill in the blank: She was always accompanied ___ her mother whenever she went out.
questions.explanation: 'Accompanied by' means to go with someone.

questions.question: Fill in the blank: I am not accustomed ___ having a heavy breakfast.
questions.explanation: 'Accustomed to' means used to something.

questions.question: Fill in the blank: He is addicted ___ playing video games.
questions.explanation: 'Addicted to' means obsessed with a particular activity.

questions.question: Fill in the blank: We approve ___ her choice of pursuing this course.
questions.explanation: 'Approve of' means to have a positive feeling towards something.

questions.question: Fill in the blank: They seem bent ___ going ahead with their programme.
questions.explanation: 'Bent on' means very determined to do something.
